profile_positions.title: Global CFO and Head of Strategy & Transformation

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for FP&A, Business Control and Commercial Finance functions of a US$1bn business line. Key areas of responsibility:
- Partnering with the business
- Budgeting and Forecasting of all operations within the line of business
- Coordinating weekly projections of all operating BU’s within the line of business
- Coordinating Monthly Business Reviews with our Global Executive Management team (presenting to the Board for my area of responsibility)
- Coordinating New Business review process (Finance sign off) including pricing of business and protection of Company’s assets
- Drive a finance restructuring program (eliminate overhead out of direct operating cost)
- Working Capital Management (DSO and DPO)
- Negotiate customer and vendor terms
- Completeness, accuracy and timeliness of billing (including driving efficiency and eliminating revenue leakage through centralization)
- Collection of overdue receivables
- Drive quarterly payment deferral programs
- Implementation of supply chain finance program(s)
- Coordinating operational and financial audits
- Drive ROI from investments and create visibility to that ROI
- Cost controlling
profile_positions.title: Vice President Finance | North America Contract Logistics

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for overseeing the Record to Report (RTR) function within the North America cluster (US$2bn revenue). My key responsibilities were:
- Implementing a new Financial System (JDE9.1) within the North America cluster
- Implementing a procurement system (Web3) within the North America cluster
- Transitioning the finance department, including outsourcing of activities
- Drive fast close project. Shortened monthly closing timeline from 5 to 3 days
- Oversee monthly general ledger closing process including approval of journal entries and review of account reconciliations
- Ensures robust balance sheet through balance sheet account reconciliations
- Ensures compliance with regulatory, tax and other government filings
- Monthly cluster level financial reporting and reporting pack review for accuracy
- Responsible for ensuring internal controls are functioning properly in areas of responsibility 
- Responsible for ensuring company policies and procedures are followed and desk procedures are maintained for departments
- Responsible for budgeting and forecasting of finance departments (SG&A)
- Coordinates with various corporate departments (Payroll, Procurement, treasury, Risk Management, IT and field regional controllers)
- Coordinates with external and internal auditors for audits of entity’s accounts
profile_positions.title: Director | North America Controller

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for managing the Group's internal and external reporting of a US$7bn company (Global Head Office of a Multinational Corporation). As from late 2015, this was extended to oversee the corporate FP&A function as well. My key responsibilities were:
- Leading role in the Initial Public Offering project of the CEVA Group
- Preparing the presentation for the Group’s quarterly Earnings Call
- Manage the Group financial closing process and lead the Group reporting team by coordinating all tasks during the month-, quarter- and year-end closing of approximately 160 reporting entities worldwide
- Manage the Group's consolidation process
- Liaise with the external auditor to ensure a smooth audit process and manage the content of the Annual Report, Interim Financial Statements and other external reporting under IFRS
- Managing complete and accurate deliverable of Prepared-By-Client-List (PBC) documentation for the external auditors on a quarterly basis
- Manage day to day activities of the Group reporting team members to ensure that reporting output is delivered complete and accurately by the agreed and required timetable and standards
- Managing monthly review of financial data reported by all reporting entities within the Group
- Analysis of internal management reporting to different stakeholders (CFO, Board of Managers, Investors, Customers)
- Writing and maintaining the Group Accounting Manual (IFRS)
- Coaching and performance management of members of the Group reporting team (four direct reports)
profile_positions.title: Reporting Manager

profile_positions.description:
My key responsibilities as Financial Controller of the Americas region (US$2.6bn) were: 
- Monthly review and analysis of all reporting entities within the Americas region (approximately 40 reporting entities)
- First point of contact within CEVA's Global Head Office for all accounting related questions and issues within the region
- Answering ad-hoc questions from the region, Group Finance Director, CFO, and other stakeholders • Writing and maintaining the Group Accounting Manual, Account Definitions, other Group Policies & Procedures and Position Papers
- Provide training on accounting topics (IFRS) and Consolidation system (HFM)
- Improve data quality

The main projects I participated in during my role as Financial Controller are as follows:
- Project leader of CEVA Holdings LLC's 2013 Annual Report (Group’s Financial Statements) and Interim Financial Statements
- Participated in CEVA's March 2014 refinancing project (refinancing total debt of US$1,75bn)
profile_positions.title: Financial Controller - Americas

profile_positions.description:
Worked as an external auditor holding various positions. In my last role my key responsibilities were as follows:
- Managing a portfolio of large and medium sized clients and deliver high quality audit and assurance service, including preparing and reviewing audit plans and audit work
- Managing budgets, WIP, timely billing and collection and variance recognition
- Coach, train and develop auditing staff

Besides my work as an external auditor within KPMG I had the opportunity to work for other departments during low-season to gain out-of-the-box-experience. The departments I worked for as are as follows:
- Transaction Services (Mergers and Acquisitions)
- Risk Management
- Forensic & Integrity (Fraud Investigation)
- Holding & Finance
